Summary 20+ years experience developing documentation for application developers and business users. Quick to learn new technologies. Experienced in leading large projects. Enjoy working in a team and collaborating. Experienced designing single-sourced documentation for multiple platforms and formats. Create concise, modular technical documentation that meets accessibility, translation, and style requirements. Experience Advisory Software Engineer, Project Lead IBM April 2006  – Present (9 years 5 months) Littleton, MA Project Lead / Advisory Software Engineer: 
IBM Domino Designer with XPages and Domino REST APIs, 2007 – present 
Eclipse-based application development tools for creating Notes, web, and cloud applications. Supports Java, JavaScript, LotusScript, formula language programming, and drag-and-drop UI creation. 
 
While working in an Agile environment, responsible for creating developer/programmability documentation (9000+ topics) using DITA XML as single source authoring format. Write and connect context-sensitive help. Use progressive-disclosure principles. Verify accessibility of documentation and coordinate translation and publishing. Documentation is output in multiple formats. Maintain and update Knowledge Center doc collections and related public product wikis. Current subjects documented include Domino REST APIs, XPages application development, and XPages in Bluemix. 
 
Project Lead / Advisory Software Engineer: 
 
IBM Domino Designer with Composite Applications, 2006-2007  
Eclipse-based development tools. A composite application lets multiple independently-created components (Eclipse, Notes, Java) be assembled into a single context and wired together so that an action in one component triggers another component. 
 
Project completed in an Agile environment. Wrote developer documentation and context-sensitive. Coordinated translation and publishing processes. Documentation is output in multiple formats. Maintain and update related public product wiki. 
 
Advisory Software Engineer / Principal Technical Writer: 
 
IBM Domino Designer (first Eclipse release) and Workplace API toolkits, 2006  
Notes-based application development IDE for creating Notes applications and web applications. Domino Designer code base was later migrated to Eclipse to create an even more rapid development tool.  
 
Wrote developer documentation and context-sensitive help. Coordinated translation and publishing processes. Documentation is output in multiple formats. Principal Technical Writer IBM January 1996  – Present (19 years 8 months) Littleton, MA Advisory Information Developer / Advisory Software Engineer: 
Workplace Server API toolkit and Web Services, IBM Lotus Learning Management System, Workplace Collaborative Learning Products, WebSphere Portal, April 2002 – April 2006 
API and SDK developer toolkits for Workplace Server, Workplace JAVA API and Web Services, Lotus Expeditor (WED) Portal JSP, Web-based e-learning course creation and delivery tools that run on Lotus Domino and WebSphere Application Server.  
 
Wrote developer documentation, reference material, and context-sensitive help. Coordinated translation and publishing processes. Documentation was output in multiple formats including HTML help, JSP help, API Javadoc, doc plugins, and PDFs. 
 
Advisory Information Developer / Principal Technical Writer: 
Lotus Knowledge Management products including Discovery Server Java API, Lotus WorkFlow, K-station Portlet SDK, September 1999 to April 2002 
 
Project Leader / Principal Technical Writer: 
Lotus eSuite DevPack, February 1998 to September 1999 
Java applet development tool and suite of business applications. 
 
Senior Technical Writer: 
Lotus Components (OCXs) Suite, January 1996 to February 1998 
Java applet development tool and suite of business applications. Experience Publicist and Manager Adventures of TikiMan June 2015  – Present (3 months) Roving in the U.S. I'm now retired from technical writing and am hitting the road in a 27' foot Coach House RV with my husband, our cat, and my former cubicle companion, TikiMan. We are guiding the Adventures of TikiMan as we travel across the U.S. visiting faraway friends, national parks, tiny-house communities, co-ops, organic farms, and whatever else interests us. See what we learn and discover on the Adventures of TikiMan Facebook page.
